[[Barbara Morse (Earth-616)|Mockingbird]]
'''Girl Geniuses:'''
[[Alima (G.I.R.L.) (Earth-616)|Alima]], [[Amber Silverstein (Earth-616)|Amber Silverstein]], [[Jeanne Foucault (Earth-616)|Jeanne Foucault]], [[Brilliance (Justine) (Earth-616)|Justine]], [[Alexis Miranda (Earth-616)|Lexi Miranda]], [[Nadia Van Dyne (Earth-616)|Nadia Van Dyne]], [[Priya Aggarwal (Earth-616)|Priya Aggarwal]], [[Priscilla LaShayla Smith (Earth-616)|Shay Smith]], [[Taina Miranda (Earth-616)|Tai Miranda]], [[Ying Liu (Earth-616)|Ying Liu]] | FormerMembers = | Allies = [[Avengers (Earth-616)|Avengers]], [[Matthew Murdock (Earth-616)|Daredevil]], [[Edwin Jarvis (Earth-616)|Edwin Jarvis]], [[Lunella Lafayette (Earth-616)|Moon Girl]], [[Janet Van Dyne (Earth-616)|Wasp]] | Enemies = [[Advanced Idea Mechanics (Earth-616)|A.I.M.]], [[Black Widow Ops Program (Earth-616)|Black Widow Ops Program]] | Origin = | PlaceOfFormation = [[New York City]], [[New York (State)|New York]], [[United States of America|USA]] | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = Jeremy Whitley; Elsa Charretier | First = Unstoppable Wasp Vol 1 2 | History = {{Quote|'''G.I.R.L. G'''enius '''I'''n action '''R'''esearch '''L'''abs is dedicated to finding the brilliant girls and women who will not just save the [[Earth|world]], but '''change''' it.|[[Nadia Van Dyne (Earth-616)|Wasp]] {{r|Unstoppable Wasp Vol 1 2}}}} After mentioning that [[Strategic Homeland Intervention, Enforcement and Logistics Division (Earth-616)|S.H.I.E.L.D.]]'s list of most intelligent [[Homo sapiens|humans]] listed women no higher than 27th, [[Nadia Van Dyne (Earth-616)|Nadia Pym]] was prompted to start '''Geniuses In action Research Labs''', an enterprise to assess the [[Earth]]'s greatest female scientific minds and convince S.H.I.E.L.D. that their list was outdated and in need of revision.{{r|Unstoppable Wasp Vol 1 1}} To that end Nadia enlisted [[Edwin Jarvis (Earth-616)|Edwin Jarvis]] to take her to [[New York City]] where she recruited [[Taina Miranda (Earth-616)|Tai]] and [[Alexis Miranda (Earth-616)|Lexi Miranda]] in the [[Washington Heights]] neighborhood of [[Manhattan]]. Nadia next went to the [[Lower East Side]] and spoke with [[Lunella Lafayette (Earth-616)|Lunella Lafayette]];{{r|Unstoppable Wasp Vol 1 2}} however, although the [[Inhumans (Inhomo supremis)|Inhuman]] liked the idea, she was too busy to commit to the project herself. Jarvis then took Nadia to [[Times Square]], but the person she wanted to talk with didn't work until later that night, so they continued to the [[Brownsville]] neighborhood of [[Brooklyn]], where [[Priscilla LaShayla Smith (Earth-616)|Shay Smith]] joined G.I.R.L.'s ranks. Returning to [[Manhattan#Midtown Manhattan|Midtown]], Nadia finally met with the last name on her list, [[Priya Aggarwal (Earth-616)|Priya Aggarwal]]; however, the young woman stated she wasn't interested, as she'd rather be popular than smart.{{r|Unstoppable Wasp Vol 1 3}} She soon changed her mind though when Nadia donned the [[Wasp's Suit]] and saved Priya's mother from [[Marian Pouncy (Earth-616)|Poundcakes]] and [[Hellen Feliciano (Earth-616)|Letha]] of the [[Grapplers (Earth-616)|Grapplers]].{{r|Unstoppable Wasp Vol 1 4}} | Equipment = [[Wasp's Suit]] and [[Bio-Synthetic Wings]] | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = | Trivia = * Writer [[Jeremy Whitley]] created G.I.R.L. in order to highlight women scientists in the Marvel universe, and bring more diversity to a field consisting mostly of adult male characters. Nerdist: [https://nerdist.com/article/unstoppable-wasp-interview-sam-maggs-jeremy-whitley/ UNSTOPPABLE WASP Writers Discuss Nadia Van Dyne, July 28, 2020] | Links = }} [[Category:Jeremy Whitley/Creator]] [[Category:Elsa Charretier/Creator]] [[Category:Think Tanks]]
